intro: Thyrsodium guianense, commonly known as the Guianan thrysoide, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters called thyrses, which give the plant its scientific name.
